meanings.def: the lowest part of something
examples: the bottom of the screen/stairs/hill
at the bottom of something Footnotes are given at the bottom of each page.
at the bottom The book I want is right at the bottom (= of the pile).
The wind blew through gaps at the top and bottom of the door.
farmers who lived in the valley bottoms
Footnotes are given at the bottom of each page.
I waited for them at the bottom of the hill.
The lamp has a heavy base.
to lay the foundations of the new school
At the foot of the stairs she turned to face him.
He reached the bottom of the steps in no time.
We rode along the bottom of the valley.
We walked to the bottom of the hill.
She was waiting near the bottom of the stairs.
There are subtitles along the bottom of the screen.
It took them six hours to reach the bottom of the mountain.

meanings.def: the part of something that faces downwards and is not usually seen
examples: The bottom of the pan was all sticky.
on the bottom of something The ingredients are listed on the bottom of the box
The manufacturer's name is on the bottom of the plate.

meanings.def: the lowest surface on the inside of a container
examples: Line the bottom of the cage with newspaper.
at the bottom of something I found some coins at the bottom of my bag.
a case with a false bottom
strange sounds from the bottom of the well
Allow the tea leaves to settle to the bottom of the cup.

meanings.def: the ground below the water in a lake, the sea, a swimming pool, etc.
examples: I feel safe as long as I can touch the bottom.
on the bottom (of something) He dived in and hit his head on the bottom.
to the bottom (of something) The boat sank to the bottom of the sea.
She could only just touch the bottom.
These fish spend most of their lives on the river bottom.

meanings.def: the lowest position in a class, on a list, etc.; a person, team, etc. that is in this position
examples: When the list came out, my name was near the bottom.
I was always bottom of the class in math.
at the bottom of something a battle between the teams at the bottom of the league
at the bottom You have to be prepared to start at the bottom and work your way up.
He's near the bottom of the class.
He started at the bottom and worked his way up through the company.
Things are much worse at the bottom of the educational ladder.
In terms of economic performance, we are near the bottom of the table.

meanings.def: the part of the body that you sit on
examples: We sat on our bottoms on the damp grass.

meanings.def: the lower part of a set of clothes that consists of two pieces
examples: a pair of pyjama/tracksuit bottoms
a bikini bottom

meanings.def: the part of something that is furthest from you, your house, etc.
examples: at the bottom of something There was a stream at the bottom of the garden.
I went to the school at the bottom of our street.

meanings.def: the lower part of a ship that is below the surface of the water
having the type of bottom mentioned
examples: a flat-bottomed boat

meanings.def: used to say what somebody/something is really like
examples: Their offer to help was at bottom self-centred.

meanings.def: high up/low down in the structure of an organization or a society
examples: These workers are at the bottom of the economic heap.

meanings.def: to be the original cause of something, especially something unpleasant
examples: We need to find out what lies at the bottom of these fears.
I'd love to know what lies at the bottom of all this.

meanings.def: people stop buying or using the products of a particular industry
examples: The bottom has fallen out of the travel market.

meanings.def: in the least/most important position in a group of people or things
examples: It’s been 20 years since a British player was top of the pile.
The government is doing little to help those at the bottom of the social pile.

meanings.def: used to express good wishes when drinking alcohol, or to tell somebody to finish their drink
in a way that is sincere
examples: I beg you, from the bottom of my heart, to spare his life.
It was clearly an offer that came from the heart.
I could tell he spoke from the heart.

meanings.def: going to every part of a place in a very careful way
examples: We cleaned the house from top to bottom.

meanings.def: to find out the real cause of something, especially something unpleasant
examples: I won’t rest until I’ve got to the bottom of this!
The only way to get to the bottom of it is to confront the chairman.

meanings.def: a situation in which companies and countries compete with each other to produce goods as cheaply as possible by paying low wages and giving workers poor conditions and few rights
examples: They are caught in the cheap food syndrome, the race to the bottom, the chase for the lowest cost of production globally.

meanings.def: to have to use things or people that are not the best or most suitable because the ones that were the best or most suitable are no longer available
to reach the ground at the bottom of an area of water
examples: I put my feet down and touched bottom.

meanings.def: to reach the worst possible state or condition
examples: Her career really touched bottom with that movie.

meanings.def: in the lowest, last or furthest place or position
examples: your bottom lip
the bottom line/row/edge
on the bottom left/right of the page
in the bottom corner of the screen
on the bottom shelf
Their house is at the bottom end of Bury Road (= the end furthest from where you enter the road).
Put your clothes in the bottom drawer.
to go up a hill in bottom gear
She was sitting on the bottom step.

meanings.def: the lowest or last position in a scale or competition
examples: the bottom end of the price range
We came bottom with 12 points.
We finished bottom of the league.
They finished six points ahead of bottom club Swindon.
a cut in the bottom income-tax bracket from 15% to 10%

meanings.def: used to say that you are certain that something will happen
examples: You can bet your bottom dollar that he'll be late.

meanings.def: a comic character in Shakespeare's play A Midsummer Night's Dream. For most of the play, Bottom has the head of an ass (= an animal like a small horse with long ears) because of a magic trick played by Oberon.
